p: Five recent soybean releases were selected for these experiments including, UA5014C, UA5414RR, JTN-5503, JTN-5110, and JTN-5203. These lines were reported to have a higher yielding potential in a statewide comparison and resistance to common diseases in southern states of US ( Table 1). The UA5014C and UA5414RR lines were developed by the Arkansas Agricultural Experiment Station, while JTN-5503, JTN-5110, and JTN-5203 were developed at USDA-ARS Jackson Research Station. Parental information for these lines is provided in Table 1. These lines were grown at the Tennessee State University research farm in 2017. The experimental unit consisted of three replicates with two rows (20 feet deep) and a planting density of 5 seeds/ft.
